Editions:

Internal migration - Matrices of moves between Local Authorities and Regions (including the countries of Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland)

Highlights

Population Estimates for UK, England and Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland: mid-2016

What's in the bulletin?

  • The population of the UK at 30 June 2016 is estimated to be 65,648,000 people.
  • Over the year to mid-2016, the number of people resident in the UK increased by 0.8% (538,000), this growth rate is similar to the average annual growth rate since 2005.
  • The population increase of the UK reflected increases of 193,000 people through natural growth (35.8% of the total increase), 336,000 through net international migration (62.4% of the total increase) and an increase of 9,500 people in the armed forces population based in the UK.
Read this statistical bulletin
More publications

Datasets

  • Local Area Migration Indicators, UK

    Interactive product bringing together different migration-related data sources at local authority level.

  • Internal migration - Detailed estimates dataset by origin and destination local authorities, sex and single year of age

    Table 1a/b Moves into and out of each local authority (LA) within England and Wales (including moves to and from Scotland and Northern Ireland).

  • 2011 Census: Detailed UK migration statistics

    2011 Census internal migration statistics for the UK give estimates that classify people and households in areas within the UK and those having moved from each area to elsewhere within the UK in the year preceding the Census.

  • Internal migration - Moves by Local Authorities and Regions in England and Wales by 5 year age group and sex

    2 tables: Table T5 Internal migration by local authorities in England and Wales by 5 year age group and sex Table T6 Internal migration by regions in England and Wales by 5 year age group and sex.

  • Internal migration - LA and Region moves and by sex and single year of age totals

    3 tables: Table T2 Internal migration by local authorities in England and Wales Table T3 Internal migration by English regions and Wales Table T4 Internal migration by sex and single year of age.

Publications

Bulletins

  • Population Estimates for UK, England and Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland: mid-2016

    Estimates of the usual resident population as at 30 June 2016. This release includes national and subnational population estimates for England and Wales, Scotland, and Northern Ireland. Presented as available by administrative area, single year of age, sex and components of population change. This statistical bulletin covers both the UK mid-year population estimates for 2016 and the mid-2016 internal migration estimates for England and Wales.

  • Internal migration, England and Wales: Year Ending June 2015

    Residential moves between local authorities and regions in England and Wales, as well as moves to or from the rest of the UK (Scotland and Northern Ireland).

View all related statistical bulletins
